scale.description: 空間的・スケール的条件

FND.ahistorical.name: ahistorical
FND.ahistorical.definition_en: Existing outside of or without reference to history.

positive: This exists in an ahistorical vacuum.
negative: The historical roots go back centuries.

FND.history.name: history
FND.history.definition_en: The continuous record of past events; heritage.

FND.body.name: body
FND.body.definition_en: The physical form of a being; corporeal existence.

negative: This is a matter of the mind.

FND.mind.name: mind
FND.mind.definition_en: The faculty of consciousness and thought.

FND.consciousness.name: consciousness
FND.consciousness.definition_en: The state of being aware of existence and surroundings.

FND.information.name: information
FND.information.definition_en: Data or facts that provide meaning.

FND.labor.name: labor
FND.labor.definition_en: Productive work or effort for a purpose.

FND.play.name: play
FND.play.definition_en: Activity for enjoyment rather than serious purpose.

FND.language.name: language
FND.language.definition_en: A system of communication using symbols.

negative: Let me put this into words.

FND.memory.name: memory
FND.memory.definition_en: The faculty of retaining and recalling experiences.

positive: He lived in a memoryless present.
The concept exists in a spaceless realm.

FND.spatiality.name: spatiality
FND.spatiality.definition_en: The quality of having spatial extension.

FND.temporality.name: temporality
FND.temporality.definition_en: The quality of existing within time.

FND.timeless.name: timeless
FND.timeless.definition_en: Existing outside of or unaffected by time.

negative: This is a product of its time.

FND.time.name: time
FND.time.definition_en: The continued progress of existence; duration.

TIM.moment.name: moment
TIM.moment.definition_en: A very brief period of time.

FND.transformation.name: transformation
FND.transformation.definition_en: A thorough change in form or nature.

FND.unchanging.name: unchanging
FND.unchanging.definition_en: Remaining the same; not subject to change.

EXS.absence.name: absence
EXS.absence.definition_en: The state of not being present; nonexistence in a place.

EXS.presence.name: presence
EXS.presence.definition_en: The state of being present in a place.

positive: The being of consciousness is mysterious.
negative: In the void, there was nothing.

EXS.nonbeing.name: nonbeing
EXS.nonbeing.definition_en: The state of not existing; absence of being.

EXS.death.name: death
EXS.death.definition_en: The permanent cessation of life; end of existence.

EXS.life.name: life
EXS.life.definition_en: The condition of living organisms; vitality.

EXS.physical_body.name: physical_body
EXS.physical_body.definition_en: The material form of a living being; flesh.

EXS.spirit.name: spirit
EXS.spirit.definition_en: The non-physical part of a being; soul or mind.

EXS.vitality.name: vitality
EXS.vitality.definition_en: The state of being alive and full of energy.

STA.danger.name: danger
STA.danger.definition_en: A situation involving exposure to harm.

PRP.aged.name: aged
PRP.aged.definition_en: Having lived for a long time; old.

PRP.young.name: young
PRP.young.definition_en: In an early period of life; not old.

PRP.blunt.name: blunt
PRP.blunt.definition_en: Not having a sharp edge; dull.

PRP.sharp.name: sharp
PRP.sharp.definition_en: Having a fine edge or point.

positive: Be careful with that sharp knife.

PRP.clean.name: clean
PRP.clean.definition_en: Free from dirt or stains; pure.

PRP.clear.name: clear
PRP.clear.definition_en: Transparent; easy to see through or understand.

PRP.difficult.name: difficult
PRP.difficult.definition_en: Needing much effort; hard to do.

PRP.near.name: near
PRP.near.definition_en: At a short distance; close by.

PRP.heavy.name: heavy
PRP.heavy.definition_en: Of great weight; difficult to lift.

PRP.light.name: light
PRP.light.definition_en: Of little weight; easy to lift.

PRP.impossible.name: impossible
PRP.impossible.definition_en: Not able to occur or be done.

PRP.possible.name: possible
PRP.possible.definition_en: Able to be done or happen.

PRP.wide.name: wide
PRP.wide.definition_en: Having great extent from side to side.

PRP.old.name: old
PRP.old.definition_en: Having existed for a long time.

PRP.part.name: part
PRP.part.definition_en: A piece or segment of a whole.

EMO.anger.name: anger
EMO.anger.definition_en: A strong feeling of displeasure or hostility.

EMO.compassion.name: compassion
EMO.compassion.definition_en: Deep awareness of suffering with wish to relieve it.

EMO.anxiety.name: anxiety
EMO.anxiety.definition_en: A feeling of worry or unease about uncertain outcomes.

EMO.wish.name: wish
EMO.wish.definition_en: A feeling of hope or desire for something to happen.

EMO.apology.name: apology
EMO.apology.definition_en: An expression of regret for one's action, acknowledging responsibility.

positive: I'm sorry I hurt you. I take full responsibility.
negative: I forgive you for what happened.

EMO.forgiveness.name: forgiveness
EMO.forgiveness.definition_en: The act of releasing resentment; granting pardon.

negative: I'm so sorry for what I did.

EMO.contempt.name: contempt
EMO.contempt.definition_en: A feeling that something is beneath consideration; disdain.

EMO.respect.name: respect
EMO.respect.definition_en: A feeling of admiration for qualities or achievements.

EMO.courage.name: courage
EMO.courage.definition_en: The ability to face fear or danger with confidence.

EMO.fear.name: fear
EMO.fear.definition_en: An unpleasant emotion caused by perception of danger.

EMO.desire.name: desire
EMO.desire.definition_en: A strong feeling of wanting something.

EMO.satisfaction.name: satisfaction
EMO.satisfaction.definition_en: Fulfillment of wishes or needs; contentment.

EMO.hope.name: hope
EMO.hope.definition_en: A feeling of expectation for something positive.

EMO.dislike.name: dislike
EMO.dislike.definition_en: A feeling of distaste or aversion.

EMO.like.name: like
EMO.like.definition_en: A feeling of enjoyment or favorable regard.

EMO.doubt.name: doubt
EMO.doubt.definition_en: A feeling of uncertainty or lack of conviction.

EMO.trust.name: trust
EMO.trust.definition_en: Firm belief in reliability or truth of someone.

EMO.happiness.name: happiness
EMO.happiness.definition_en: A state of well-being with positive emotions.

EMO.unhappiness.name: unhappiness
EMO.unhappiness.definition_en: A state of discontent or misery.

EMO.hate.name: hate
EMO.hate.definition_en: An intense feeling of dislike or hostility.

EMO.love.name: love
EMO.love.definition_en: An intense feeling of deep affection and care.

EMO.joy.name: joy
EMO.joy.definition_en: A feeling of great pleasure and happiness.

EMO.sorrow.name: sorrow
EMO.sorrow.definition_en: Deep distress caused by loss or disappointment.

EMO.manifest.name: manifest
EMO.manifest.definition_en: The outward expression of inner feelings.

EMO.patience.name: patience
EMO.patience.definition_en: The capacity to accept delay without anger.

EMO.pleasure.name: pleasure
EMO.pleasure.definition_en: A feeling of enjoyment or satisfaction.

EMO.worry.name: worry
EMO.worry.definition_en: Mental distress from concern about troubles.

EMO.pride.name: pride
EMO.pride.definition_en: Satisfaction from one's achievements or qualities.

EMO.shame.name: shame
EMO.shame.definition_en: A painful feeling from awareness of wrong behavior.

ACT.abandon.name: abandon
ACT.abandon.definition_en: To give up completely; to leave behind or desert.

ACT.build.name: build
ACT.build.definition_en: To construct by putting together parts or materials.

ACT.agitate.name: agitate
ACT.agitate.definition_en: To disturb, stir up, or cause unrest and turbulence.

ACT.calm.name: calm
ACT.calm.definition_en: To make peaceful or tranquil; to soothe or quiet.

ACT.arrive.name: arrive
ACT.arrive.definition_en: To reach a destination; to come to a place.

positive: They finally arrived after a long journey.

ACT.exit.name: exit
ACT.exit.definition_en: To go out of or leave a place; departure from a location.

positive: Please exit through the back door.

ACT.ascend.name: ascend
ACT.ascend.definition_en: To go or move upward; to rise to a higher level.

positive: The balloon ascended into the sky.
negative: The elevator descended to the basement.

ACT.descend.name: descend
ACT.descend.definition_en: To move downward; to go from higher to lower.

ACT.create.name: create
ACT.create.definition_en: To bring into existence; to produce something new.

ACT.destroy.name: destroy
ACT.destroy.definition_en: To put an end to the existence of; to demolish completely.

negative: They worked to build and preserve.

ACT.dissolve.name: dissolve
ACT.dissolve.definition_en: To cause to disappear or disperse; to break apart.

ACT.make.name: make
ACT.make.definition_en: To form, construct, or produce by combining materials or effort.

ACT.emit.name: emit
ACT.emit.definition_en: To send out or give off; to produce and discharge.

positive: The sun emits light and heat.

ACT.receive.name: receive
ACT.receive.definition_en: To take in or accept something given, sent, or transmitted.

ACT.fall.name: fall
ACT.fall.definition_en: To move downward due to gravity; to drop from a higher position.

negative: The balloon rose into the air.

ACT.sink.name: sink
ACT.sink.definition_en: To go down below the surface; to descend gradually.

negative: The buoy floated on the surface.

ACT.give.name: give
ACT.give.definition_en: To transfer possession freely; to provide without expecting return.

ACT.take.name: take
ACT.take.definition_en: To get into one's possession; to receive or acquire.

positive: He took responsibility for the mistake.

ACT.go.name: go
ACT.go.definition_en: To move from one place to another; to proceed or travel.

ACT.leave.name: leave
ACT.leave.definition_en: To go away from a place or person; to depart.

positive: She decided to leave and start fresh.

TIM.appear.name: appear
TIM.appear.definition_en: To become visible; to come into sight.

ACT.lie_down.name: lie_down
ACT.lie_down.definition_en: To assume a horizontal position; to recline for rest.

ACT.rise.name: rise
ACT.rise.definition_en: To move from a lower to a higher position; to get up.

positive: The sun rises in the east.

ACT.lose.name: lose
ACT.lose.definition_en: To be deprived of or cease to have something.

negative: He found what he was looking for.

ACT.obtain.name: obtain
ACT.obtain.definition_en: To get or acquire something through effort or request.

ACT.move.name: move
ACT.move.definition_en: To change position or place; to cause motion.

positive: They moved to a new city.
negative: The statue remained fixed in place.

ACT.stop.name: stop
ACT.stop.definition_en: To cease movement or action; to bring to a halt.

positive: The car stopped at the light.

ACT.sit.name: sit
ACT.sit.definition_en: To rest with the body supported by the buttocks.

ACT.stand.name: stand
ACT.stand.definition_en: To be in an upright position on one's feet.

CHG.advance.name: advance
CHG.advance.definition_en: To move forward; to make progress.

CHG.retreat.name: retreat
CHG.retreat.definition_en: To move back or withdraw; to regress.

CHG.begin.name: begin
CHG.begin.definition_en: To start; to commence an action or process.

CHG.end.name: end
CHG.end.definition_en: To bring to a conclusion; to finish.

CHG.decay.name: decay
CHG.decay.definition_en: To deteriorate or decompose over time; to decline.

CHG.grow.name: grow
CHG.grow.definition_en: To increase in size or develop; to mature.

CHG.stay.name: stay
CHG.stay.definition_en: To remain in a place; to continue without change.

COG.separate.name: separate
COG.separate.definition_en: To set apart; to divide or distinguish from others.

VAL.beauty.name: beauty
VAL.beauty.definition_en: A quality that gives pleasure to the senses.

positive: The beauty took her breath away.

VAL.ugliness.name: ugliness
VAL.ugliness.definition_en: A quality that displeases the senses.

VAL.incorrect.name: incorrect
VAL.incorrect.definition_en: Not in accordance with fact; wrong.

VAL.falsehood.name: falsehood
VAL.falsehood.definition_en: The state of being untrue; a lie.

VAL.truth.name: truth
VAL.truth.definition_en: The quality of being true; conformity with fact.

VAL.sacred.name: sacred
VAL.sacred.definition_en: Connected with God or religion; holy.

STA.comfort.name: comfort
STA.comfort.definition_en: A state of physical ease; freedom from pain.

STA.healing.name: healing
STA.healing.definition_en: The process of becoming healthy again.

STA.health.name: health
STA.health.definition_en: The state of being free from illness.

STA.illness.name: illness
STA.illness.definition_en: A disease or period of sickness.

STA.poverty.name: poverty
STA.poverty.definition_en: The state of being extremely poor.

COG.confusion.name: confusion
COG.confusion.definition_en: A state of being bewildered or unclear in mind.

COG.enlightenment.name: enlightenment
COG.enlightenment.definition_en: The state of having knowledge or understanding; clarity.

COG.forget.name: forget
COG.forget.definition_en: To fail to remember; to lose from memory.

COG.remember.name: remember
COG.remember.definition_en: To recall from memory; to keep in mind.

COG.ignorance.name: ignorance
COG.ignorance.definition_en: Lack of knowledge or information; unawareness.

COG.know.name: know
COG.know.definition_en: To be aware of through observation or experience.

COG.instinct.name: instinct
COG.instinct.definition_en: An innate, typically fixed pattern of behavior; natural impulse.

COG.intention.name: intention
COG.intention.definition_en: A mental plan or aim; purpose behind an action.

COG.learn.name: learn
COG.learn.definition_en: To acquire knowledge or skill through study or experience.

COG.unlearned.name: unlearned
COG.unlearned.definition_en: Lacking education or knowledge; not having learned.

COG.mindless.name: mindless
COG.mindless.definition_en: Without thought or mental activity; automatic.

COG.think.name: think
COG.think.definition_en: To use the mind to consider or reason; to reflect.

COM.announce.name: announce
COM.announce.definition_en: To make publicly known; to declare formally.

COM.secret.name: secret
COM.secret.definition_en: Something kept hidden from others; confidential.

COM.answer.name: answer
COM.answer.definition_en: A response to a question; a reply or solution.

COM.question.name: question
COM.question.definition_en: A sentence seeking information; an inquiry.

COM.conduct.name: conduct
COM.conduct.definition_en: The manner of managing or carrying out activities.

COM.muteness.name: muteness
COM.muteness.definition_en: The state of being unable or unwilling to speak.

COM.conflict.name: conflict
COM.conflict.definition_en: A serious disagreement or struggle; opposition.

COM.cooperate.name: cooperate
COM.cooperate.definition_en: To work together toward a common goal; collaborate.

COM.practice.name: practice
COM.practice.definition_en: Repeated exercise to acquire skill; rehearsal.

COM.teach.name: teach
COM.teach.definition_en: To impart knowledge or skill; to instruct.

COM.speak.name: speak
COM.speak.definition_en: To express thoughts in words; to communicate verbally.

PER.blind.name: blind
PER.blind.definition_en: Unable to see; lacking visual perception.

PER.see.name: see
PER.see.definition_en: To perceive with the eyes; observe.

negative: He was blind to the truth.

PER.deaf.name: deaf
PER.deaf.definition_en: Unable to hear; lacking auditory perception.

positive: He was deaf to their pleas.

PER.hear.name: hear
PER.hear.definition_en: To perceive sound with the ears.

PER.feel.name: feel
PER.feel.definition_en: To perceive through touch or emotion.

PER.numb.name: numb
PER.numb.definition_en: Deprived of sensation; unable to feel.

negative: A pleasant fragrance filled the room.

PER.smell.name: smell
PER.smell.definition_en: To perceive odor through the nose.

PER.sweet.name: sweet
PER.sweet.definition_en: Having a pleasant taste like sugar.

PER.sound.name: sound
PER.sound.definition_en: Vibrations perceived by the ear; noise.

PER.taste.name: taste
PER.taste.definition_en: The sensation of flavor perceived by tongue.

BOD.ear.name: ear
BOD.ear.definition_en: The organ of hearing; the auditory sense organ.

positive: She has a good ear for music.

BOD.eye.name: eye
BOD.eye.definition_en: The organ of sight; the visual sense organ.

BOD.face.name: face
BOD.face.definition_en: The front part of the head; one's countenance.

BOD.head.name: head
BOD.head.definition_en: The upper part of the body containing the brain.

BOD.foot.name: foot
BOD.foot.definition_en: The lower extremity of the leg used for walking.

BOD.hand.name: hand
BOD.hand.definition_en: The end part of the arm used for grasping.

BOD.hip.name: hip
BOD.hip.definition_en: The joint connecting the leg to the torso; the pelvis area.

positive: She moved her hips to the rhythm.

BOD.mouth.name: mouth
BOD.mouth.definition_en: The opening in the face used for eating and speaking.

BEI.beast.name: beast
BEI.beast.definition_en: An animal, especially a large or wild one; creature.

BEI.human.name: human
BEI.human.definition_en: A member of the human species; a person.

BEI.child.name: child
BEI.child.definition_en: A young human being; a son or daughter.

BEI.parent.name: parent
BEI.parent.definition_en: A father or mother; one who raises a child.

BEI.female.name: female
BEI.female.definition_en: Of the sex that can bear offspring; woman or girl.

BEI.male.name: male
BEI.male.definition_en: Of the sex that produces sperm; man or boy.

BEI.plant.name: plant
BEI.plant.definition_en: A living organism that grows in the ground; vegetation.

positive: The plant grew toward the light.

BEI.root.name: root
BEI.root.definition_en: The underground part of a plant; the origin or source.

SOC.defend.name: defend
SOC.defend.definition_en: To protect from harm or danger.

SOC.sleep.name: sleep
SOC.sleep.definition_en: A natural state of rest with suspended consciousness.

SOC.citizen.name: citizen
SOC.citizen.definition_en: A legally recognized member of a state.

SOC.official.name: official
SOC.official.definition_en: A person holding public office or authority.

SOC.village.name: village
SOC.village.definition_en: A small community in a rural area.

SOC.criticize.name: criticize
SOC.criticize.definition_en: To express disapproval; to find fault.

SOC.family.name: family
SOC.family.definition_en: A group of related people; household.

SOC.individual.name: individual
SOC.individual.definition_en: A single person distinct from a group.

SOC.public.name: public
SOC.public.definition_en: Of or concerning the people as a whole.

SOC.nation.name: nation
SOC.nation.definition_en: A large body of people united by common descent or government.

SOC.stateless.name: stateless
SOC.stateless.definition_en: Not recognized as a citizen of any country.

SOC.obstruct.name: obstruct
SOC.obstruct.definition_en: To block or get in the way of.

negative: The way was clear to pass.

SOC.pass.name: pass
SOC.pass.definition_en: To move past or through; to proceed.

SOC.refuse.name: refuse
SOC.refuse.definition_en: To decline to accept or comply.

SOC.rest.name: rest
SOC.rest.definition_en: To cease work or movement; relaxation.

ECO.buy.name: buy
ECO.buy.definition_en: To obtain in exchange for payment; to purchase.

ECO.sell.name: sell
ECO.sell.definition_en: To exchange for money; to trade for payment.

ECO.currency.name: currency
ECO.currency.definition_en: Paper money or official medium of exchange.

ECO.money.name: money
ECO.money.definition_en: A medium of exchange; currency in any form.

ECO.earn.name: earn
ECO.earn.definition_en: To receive payment for work or services.

ECO.loss.name: loss
ECO.loss.definition_en: The state of being deprived; deficit or damage.

ECO.income.name: income
ECO.income.definition_en: Money received regularly from work or investments.

ECO.pay.name: pay
ECO.pay.definition_en: To give money for goods or services; payment.

ECO.price.name: price
ECO.price.definition_en: The amount of money required to buy something.

ECO.waste.name: waste
ECO.waste.definition_en: Unwanted or unusable material; discarded items.

ECO.save.name: save
ECO.save.definition_en: To keep money for future use; to preserve.

ECO.withdraw.name: withdraw
ECO.withdraw.definition_en: To remove money from an account; to take out.

SPC.direction.name: direction
SPC.direction.definition_en: The course along which something moves.

positive: They headed in the right direction.

SPC.outside.name: outside
SPC.outside.definition_en: The exterior part; beyond a boundary.

positive: He was nowhere to be found.

TIM.indefinite.name: indefinite
TIM.indefinite.definition_en: Not clearly defined or determined; uncertain duration.

TIM.period.name: period
TIM.period.definition_en: A length of time with defined boundaries.

ELM.darkness.name: darkness
ELM.darkness.definition_en: The absence of light; a state of being dark.

ELM.light.name: light
ELM.light.definition_en: The natural agent that stimulates sight; brightness.

ELM.earth.name: earth
ELM.earth.definition_en: The ground; soil or land as distinct from sky or water.

ELM.fire.name: fire
ELM.fire.definition_en: The phenomenon of combustion; flames and heat.

ELM.water.name: water
ELM.water.definition_en: A colorless liquid essential for life; H2O.

ELM.moon.name: moon
ELM.moon.definition_en: Earth's natural satellite; symbol of night.

ELM.sun.name: sun
ELM.sun.definition_en: The star at the center of our solar system.

ELM.morning.name: morning
ELM.morning.definition_en: The period from sunrise to noon; early day.

ELM.night.name: night
ELM.night.definition_en: The period of darkness between sunset and sunrise.

ELM.sky.name: sky
ELM.sky.definition_en: The region of atmosphere visible from earth.

ELM.star.name: star
ELM.star.definition_en: A luminous celestial body visible at night.

NAT.flower.name: flower
NAT.flower.definition_en: The reproductive structure of flowering plants.

NAT.tree.name: tree
NAT.tree.definition_en: A perennial plant with trunk and branches.

NAT.river.name: river
NAT.river.definition_en: A large natural stream of water.

NAT.sea.name: sea
NAT.sea.definition_en: A large body of salt water; ocean.

MAT.bare_hand.name: bare_hand
MAT.bare_hand.definition_en: Using the hand without covering or tool.

positive: He caught it with bare hands.

MAT.tool.name: tool
MAT.tool.definition_en: An implement used to carry out a function.

negative: He did it with bare hands.

MAT.clothing.name: clothing
MAT.clothing.definition_en: Items worn to cover the body; garments.

LOG.cause.name: cause
LOG.cause.definition_en: Something that produces an effect; a reason.

LOG.effect.name: effect
LOG.effect.definition_en: A change produced by a cause; result.

LOG.reason.name: reason
LOG.reason.definition_en: A cause or justification for an action.

WLD.culture.name: culture
WLD.culture.definition_en: The customs and achievements of a society.

WLD.science.name: science
WLD.science.definition_en: Systematic study through observation and experiment.

WLD.outer_realm.name: outer_realm
WLD.outer_realm.definition_en: The external world beyond one's immediate sphere.

WLD.realm.name: realm
WLD.realm.definition_en: A domain or sphere of activity.

WLD.religion.name: religion
WLD.religion.definition_en: A system of faith and worship.

WLD.technique.name: technique
WLD.technique.definition_en: A method of doing something; skilled procedure.

ABS.bound.name: bound
ABS.bound.definition_en: Tied or restricted; constrained by obligation or limitation.

positive: He felt bound by his promises.
negative: She was finally free from all constraints.

ABS.release.name: release
ABS.release.definition_en: To set free from restraint or obligation; liberation.

positive: Release the tension you are holding.

ABS.exempt.name: exempt
ABS.exempt.definition_en: Free from an obligation or liability that applies to others.

positive: Children are exempt from this rule.

ABS.responsibility.name: responsibility
ABS.responsibility.definition_en: The state of being accountable for something within one's control.

negative: He was exempt from all duties.

ABS.foolish.name: foolish
ABS.foolish.definition_en: Lacking good sense or judgment; unwise behavior or thinking.

ABS.wise.name: wise
ABS.wise.definition_en: Having or showing experience, knowledge, and good judgment.

negative: Only a fool would ignore this warning.

ABS.other.name: other
ABS.other.definition_en: A person or thing that is different from oneself; another entity.

ABS.self.name: self
ABS.self.definition_en: One's own person or identity; the essential being of an individual.
